name: Couples Tower Isle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Couples Tower Isle from October 6-10th. I am a travel agent and we were here to experience the resort after the extensive renovation, so I was able to refer my clients. Overall, the experience was very positive and this is a resort I would recommend to my clients. Here are the pros and cons:
reviews.title: A great stay at Couples Tower Isle

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Service! Service! Service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: * The resort provides pool lounge floats, plenty for everyone. I really loved this because most resorts do not offer this and it really adds to the relaxation aspect.
reviews.title: Tropical Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: * The food was AMAZING. For an all inclusive, the food at the al la carte restaurants was absolutely gourmet. Every single meal was suprisingly good, and the atmosphere was always beautiful.
reviews.title: Friendliest staff on the planet!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: * This resort was a little smaller than some of the others I've visited. It made for an intimate, service oriented vacation.
reviews.title: Beautiful Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived at TI, we thought we had landed in paradise. A side note, if you're thinking of taking the TimAir flight from MoBay to Ocho Rios, skip it unless you just want to see the scenery from the air. $435/pp R/T and we got there about 15 minutes before the rest of the people on our flight who took the free shuttle.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathtub in the room was great, but not nearly as large as the pictures made it out to be (Ocean Jr. Suite). Not big enough for two to relax in. The other problem is that it would not drain. So we called maintenance, who drained out the standing water, but did not fix the problem. Called maintenance again, same thing. After four times, they finally just took the stopper out and no baths for the rest of the trip. Well, I guess that solved the initial problem.
reviews.title: Perfect Honeymoon at Couples Tower Isle
Honeymoon
reviews.text: The staff was hit and miss. Byron, who is out front and usually the first person you see when you arrive, is AMAZING! The friendliest person we met in Jamaica. If I ever decide to give this hotel another chance, he would be one of the main reasons. Meet him for one minute and he will remember your name, room # and what you like to drink. The social directors were great, and did their best to break ice when they could. But on the flipside, the lady at the currency exchange booth was awful. She seemed to be very annoyed that we would dare interrupt her daydreaming to do some work. Then she told us that we could only get $100 worth of Jamaican Dollars and wasn't the least bit helpful with any other suggestions. The staff at the all-night pool grill could use a little Red Bull maybe. They're very bleary eyed, busy chatting with the rest of the night-shift employees that occupy the counter seats, and really made us feel like an intrudance on their evening.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: According to the website, the stated policy of couples is that tips are included and that no tipping is allowed. That's true to a point. Yes, the staff doesn't expect tipping outright, but they are fast to try to sell you things on the side. I had a bartender who would constantly try to get me to buy Cuban cigars from him, and typically at a higher price than I could have gotten them elsewhere. I finally gave in and bought one, which fueled him on. I finally stopped going to that particular bar if I saw he was working. Another problem I ran into was when I was scuba diving. I decided to check out a wetsuit for two of my dives, since we were going deep and it can get cold, even in the Caribbean. When we got back from the second dive, the dive guide informed me that there is a $10 per dive charge for the wetsuits. Nowhere was this posted on the price list for extra items not included with the resort. I didn't mind the charge too much, so fine, I'll pick up the charge. But at an all-inclusive resort, who carries cash, especially when the resort is "cashless"? I told them to fill out a voucher and just charge it to my room. I was given the dirtiest look I had seen on the island and told "Mon, go upstairs and get some cash," and that they would be "waiting for me." I don't mind making a little tip on the side, but I'll be damned if I am going to have an employee ORDER me to get some cash for him. The watersports manager was in the room when this was going on, so I guess no point asking for the manager. I wrote a letter to Couples corporate office regarding it, which was ignored as was the note I left for the hotel manager.
reviews.title: Great place to unwind and enjoy yourself

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was good, but the service was, in a word, S....L....O....W.... I can understand if it's a crowded restaurant and they are understaffed. However, we were one of four tables seated at the restaurant and even then, the meal took over two hours to get through. Maybe I'm not used to island time, but I would rather eat and leave than to wait thirty minutes between courses at a restaurant.
reviews.title: Wedding and General Trip Review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a very nice post Thanksgiving vacation. Our deluxe garden room (#3315) was clean, comfortable and without issue. The housekeeper did a great job. One item: When the guest across the hall had her door open at 7:30am, the conversation was loud and noisy and woke us up.
reviews.title: Very nice resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food and Drink
reviews.title: Beautiful Location and Staff, but check in during the day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was delicious. We enjoy fresh, tasty cuisine, and the CTI chef did an excellent job. If you could think of a drink, the bartenders could make it! The beach party feast and entertainment were exceptional. The staff did a fabulous job!
reviews.title: Dream we didn’t want to wake up from…

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Activities
reviews.title: The Best Vacation Ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The trip to Dunn's River Falls was taken on Sunday, a day the cruise ships do not visit. We were the only people at the Falls. Real neat. The snorkeling was fun and nearby. Their snorkeling equipment is very good, so no need to bring your own. I wish I knew the dive spots varied, as I would have gone a second time. The catamaran trip was very enjoyable. We used the tennis court which had been resurfaced and was in great shape.
reviews.title: Tropical Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were at CTI the last week in October. The remodel is gorgeous. Honestly, our room was beautiful, housekeeping tip top, the food was unbelievable and the grounds lush. What a little paradise and all the staff (other than entertainment) is so very nice.
reviews.title: Everything fabulous, but where is entertainment staff?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, this was our third time to this resort and we have always been surprised at the apathy of the entertainment staff. Really, other than Marlon- who was great by the way- the entertainment staff was rarely around and we did not see them, or experience them, make an effort to get to know guests. In fact, it was the other way around...we observed guests trying to engage the entertainment staff. Just interesting....
reviews.title: Loved It!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for my honeymoon and my Husband and I loved it! I agree with chgofireman, Byron is great, but I would have to disagree with the other stuff mentioned. Maybe because we stayed in suites on the other side of the resort we were not exposed to mold and foam. We had a garden view. The balcony was huge. I think we had the largest balcony on our side. The jacuzzi tub was awesome too. The bed was too firm for my liking,but I called for extra pillows and they were delivered as promise. Housekeeping was wonderful. The shower pressure could use some improvement.
reviews.title: FANTASTIC! describes the facilities & staff….

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The entire staff at CTI actually has great personalities and the customer service is exceptional!
reviews.title: Dont go here if you want a Quality Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was good and I gained a good 5 pounds! The Chef provided a variety of Jamaican dishes every day. We arrived on the 9th and left on the 16th. I will be honest by Saturday and Sunday I was disappointed in the buffet, but we enjoyed the buffet better than the restaurants that you had to have reservations for. I really enjoyed the staff at the patio dining. Andre and Travis immediately came to take our empty plates and our glasses were never empty whether it was water or a drink from the bar.
reviews.title: Excellent, nice and relaxing break

description: Playground to Hollywood celebrities in the 1950s, glamorous Couples Tower Isle exudes a chic sophistication perfectly balanced by a relaxed Caribbean sensuality. Perched on the lush terrain of Ocho Rios, Jamaica—the resort seduces with breathtaking sea views, a wide sandy beach and century-old palm trees. Discover the joys of snorkeling among the reefs, windsurfing on the waves, or sailing into the sunset on a catamaran, rum punch in hand. Intricate blue tile work and jade chaise lounges offset the striking white retro architecture. Luxurious rooms boast private ocean-breeze balconies. Whether being pampered in the Zen-inspired spa—recognized as "Best in the Caribbean" by Travel+Leisure—sipping cocktails at the piano bar or indulging in an exquisite meal alfresco, Couples Tower Isle creates countless intimate moments that inspire you to return again and again.
